intro: Lampranthus saturatus, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it store water, adapting it to arid environments. It produces seed capsules that burst open when mature, dispersing seeds by wind. Lampranthus saturatus is often cultivated for its vibrant flowers and drought tolerance.
